metadata.name: Healthcare API Workspaces
metadata.description: This module deploys a Healthcare API Workspace.
Required. The name of the Health Data Services Workspace service.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Control permission for data plane traffic coming from public networks while private endpoint is enabled.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. Deploy DICOM services.
Optional. Deploy FHIR services.
Optional. Deploy IOT connectors.

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.

metadata.name: Healthcare API Workspace FHIR Services
metadata.description: This module deploys a Healthcare API Workspace FHIR Service.
Required. The name of the FHIR service.
Optional. The kind of the service. Defaults to R4.
Conditional. The name of the parent health data services workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. List of Azure AD object IDs (User or Apps) that is allowed access to the FHIR service.
Optional. The list of the Azure container registry login servers.
Optional. The list of Open Container Initiative (OCI) artifacts.
Optional. The authority url for the service.
Optional. The audience url for the service.
Optional. Specify URLs of origin sites that can access this API, or use "*" to allow access from any site.
Optional. Specify HTTP headers which can be used during the request. Use "*" for any header.
Optional. Specify the allowed HTTP methods.
Optional. Specify how long a result from a request can be cached in seconds. Example: 600 means 10 minutes.
Optional. Use this setting to indicate that cookies should be included in CORS requests.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. The name of the default export storage account.
Optional. The name of the default integration storage account.
Optional. If the import operation is enabled.
Optional. If the FHIR service is in InitialImportMode.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Control permission for data plane traffic coming from public networks while private endpoint is enabled.
Optional. The default value for tracking history across all resources.
Optional. A list of FHIR Resources and their version policy overrides.
Optional. If the SMART on FHIR proxy is enabled.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
The name of the fhir service.
The resource ID of the fhir service.
The resource group where the namespace is deployed.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The name of the fhir workspace.

metadata.name: Healthcare API Workspace DICOM Services
metadata.description: This module deploys a Healthcare API Workspace DICOM Service.
Required. The name of the DICOM service.
Conditional. The name of the parent health data services workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Specify URLs of origin sites that can access this API, or use "*" to allow access from any site.
Optional. Specify HTTP headers which can be used during the request. Use "*" for any header.
Optional. Specify the allowed HTTP methods.
Optional. Specify how long a result from a request can be cached in seconds. Example: 600 means 10 minutes.
Optional. Use this setting to indicate that cookies should be included in CORS requests.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Control permission for data plane traffic coming from public networks while private endpoint is enabled.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: The name of the dicom service.
The resource ID of the dicom service.
The resource group where the namespace is deployed.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Healthcare API Workspace IoT Connectors
metadata.description: This module deploys a Healthcare API Workspace IoT Connector.
Required. The name of the MedTech service.
Conditional. The name of the parent health data services workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Event Hub name to connect to.
Optional. Consumer group of the event hub to connected to.
Required. Namespace of the Event Hub to connect to.
Required. The mapping JSON that determines how incoming device data is normalized.
Optional. FHIR Destination.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Healthcare API Workspace IoT Connector FHIR Destinations
metadata.description: This module deploys a Healthcare API Workspace IoT Connector FHIR Destination.
Required. The name of the FHIR destination.
Required. The mapping JSON that determines how normalized data is converted to FHIR Observations.
Conditional. The name of the MedTech service to add this destination to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent health data services workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The resource identifier of the FHIR Service to connect to.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. Determines how resource identity is resolved on the destination.
The name of the FHIR destination.
The resource ID of the FHIR destination.
The resource group where the namespace is deployed.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The name of the medtech service.
The name of the medtech service.
The resource ID of the medtech service.
The resource group where the namespace is deployed.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The name of the medtech workspace.
The name of the health data services workspace.
The resource ID of the health data services workspace.
The resource group where the workspace is deployed.
The location the resource was deployed into.
